title: Hydroponic System – Waleed Salman Farm
description: Design, implementation, and handover of a complete hydroponic farming system in Waleed Salman’s farm in Bethlehem
features: Modern hydroponic system for leafy greens
High efficiency in space and water usage
Boosts local food production in limited urban space
Delivered fully operational with planting infrastructure
detailedDescription: Al-Tayseer International successfully completed the design and implementation of a hydroponic farming system in the farm of Mr. Waleed Salman in Bethlehem. The project includes 500 seedlings planted over a 25-square-meter area using advanced hydroponic technology that reduces water consumption while increasing productivity. This turnkey system supports modern, sustainable farming practices, and offers a scalable model for urban and peri-urban agriculture in Palestine.

title: BioToilet System
description: An innovative environmental solution that processes human waste to generate clean cooking gas while promoting ecological sustainability.

specifications.Sustainability: Reduces reliance on traditional energy sources

detailedDescription: The BioToilet project in Beit Fajjar Public Park introduces a natural and safe method of treating human waste to produce clean cooking gas. This sustainable system improves living conditions and reduces dependency on conventional energy resources, while fostering environmental awareness and preservation.

title: Educational Environmental Classroom
description: An integrated environmental classroom combining biogas, aquaponics, and traditional agriculture at St. George School in Ramallah, Palestine.

specifications.Biogas System: Small-scale anaerobic digester for educational use

features: NFT and Dutch bucket hydroponic systems
detailedDescription: This hands-on environmental classroom at St. George School introduces students to sustainable technologies including biogas energy generation, aquaponics farming (using both NFT and Dutch bucket systems), traditional agriculture, composting of organic waste, and seed incubation through a nursery. The space encourages experiential learning around food production, waste management, and renewable energy.

title: Educational Environmental Classroom
description: An educational environmental unit integrating biogas, hydroponics, and organic farming systems in Friends School, Ramallah.

specifications.Biogas System: Processes organic waste to produce cooking gas
specifications.Hydroponics (NFT): Soilless cultivation using nutrient film technique
specifications.Composter: Biological composting unit for waste recycling
specifications.Seed Incubator: Mini nursery for seedlings and educational use

features: Suitable for student learning and workshops
detailedDescription: This eco-friendly educational classroom at Friends School in Ramallah combines multiple green technologies into a learning platform. It includes a biogas system for processing organic waste and producing cooking gas, a hydroponic NFT setup for efficient water-based agriculture, traditional soil farming plots, a composting unit to manage biodegradable waste, and a seed nursery. The project offers students a practical understanding of sustainability, clean energy, and food security.

title: Educational Environmental Classroom
description: An educational environmental unit integrating biogas, hydroponics, and organic farming systems in Al-Mustaqbal School, Ramallah.

specifications.Biogas System: Processes organic waste to produce cooking gas
specifications.Hydroponics (NFT): Soilless cultivation using nutrient film technique
specifications.Composter: Biological composting unit for waste recycling
specifications.Seed Incubator: Mini nursery for seedlings and educational use

features: Suitable for student learning and workshops
detailedDescription: This eco-friendly educational classroom at Al-Mustaqbal School in Ramallah combines multiple green technologies into a learning platform. It includes a biogas system for processing organic waste and producing cooking gas, a hydroponic NFT setup for efficient water-based agriculture, traditional soil farming plots, a composting unit to manage biodegradable waste, and a seed nursery. The project offers students a practical understanding of sustainability, clean energy, and food security.

title: Integrated Hydroponic Farming Project
description: A 130m² hydroponic farming system accommodating 5,000 seedlings, powered by a biogas unit.

specifications.Fertilizer Output: 6 liters of organic fertilizer per day

detailedDescription: This innovative hydroponic farming project in the town of Falamia covers 130 square meters and accommodates 5,000 seedlings using advanced NFT systems. The project is supported by an integrated biogas unit that processes organic waste to generate four hours of clean cooking gas daily and six liters of organic fertilizer. It aims to enhance food security and promote sustainable agriculture through smart, eco-friendly solutions.

title: Hydroponic and Fodder Production Systems Across the West Bank
description: A multi-site project funded by the Red Cross, implementing hydroponic NFT and fodder units across 10 locations in the West Bank.
client: International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC)
detailedDescription: This large-scale agricultural development project, funded by the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC), introduced hydroponic NFT systems and automated fodder units in ten different communities across the West Bank. The initiative aims to improve food security, support small-scale farmers, and promote sustainable agriculture. Each system is designed to operate with high water efficiency and minimal environmental impact, producing fresh vegetables and nutritious green fodder year-round.

title: NFT & Dutch Bucket Hydroponic System
description: A smart hydroponic farming system combining NFT and Dutch Bucket techniques for efficient, soil-free cultivation using recycled water and nutrient-rich solutions.
detailedDescription: This innovative urban hydroponic farm maximizes food production in minimal space. Using vertical growing techniques and precision agriculture technology, the facility produces fresh vegetables year-round with 95% less water than traditional farming methods. The controlled environment ensures optimal growing conditions and eliminates the need for pesticides.

title: Greenhouse & Hydroponic Empowerment Project for Women
description: A project empowering women through greenhouse and hydroponic systems across four governorates in the West Bank.
detailedDescription: This October 2024 initiative was launched to support women in agriculture across four key governorates in the West Bank. The project installed climate-controlled greenhouses and advanced hydroponic NFT systems to enable sustainable crop production. In addition to technology deployment, the program provided technical training and business development guidance to help women manage and grow their own agricultural enterprises, fostering independence and food security in their communities.

title: Al-Tayseer 1 Building
description: A modern multi-purpose building covering 2500 square meters, designed to serve commercial and residential needs.
features: Space optimized for retail and living
detailedDescription: Al-Tayseer 1 is a landmark building project currently under development in the West Bank. Spanning 2500 sqm, the building integrates modern design with practical utility to support both commercial businesses and residential tenants. The structure is engineered for durability and sustainability, incorporating energy-efficient systems and high-quality materials.

title: Al-Tayseer 2 Building
description: A new addition to the Al-Tayseer development series, this modern building spans 2500 square meters and is designed for mixed-use functionality.
features: Ideal for mixed residential and business use
detailedDescription: Al-Tayseer 2 continues the legacy of innovative construction with a 2500 sqm layout optimized for flexibility and modern living. Located in the West Bank, the project caters to both families and businesses, offering quality spaces built to high environmental and structural standards. The design focuses on functionality, comfort, and long-term value.

title: Biogas Systems in Kafr Dan, Jenin
description: An impactful biogas project implemented for 25 farmers in Kafr Dan, providing clean cooking gas and reducing carbon emissions.
detailedDescription: This sustainable biogas initiative, funded by TIKA, was implemented in Kafr Dan (Jenin) to support 25 local farmers. Each biogas unit processes organic farm waste to generate up to 200 hours of clean cooking gas daily and 400 liters of liquid organic fertilizer. The systems contribute to environmental preservation by recycling 500 kg of organic waste per day and reducing CO₂ emissions by 130 tons annually. The project improves rural energy access while promoting eco-friendly farming practices.

title: 100kW Solar Power Station – Beit Furik & Beit Dajan
description: A 100kW solar power station installed to support local municipalities with sustainable, clean energy.
client: Joint Services Council – Beit Furik & Beit Dajan

specifications.Sustainability Contribution: Supports energy independence and reduces emissions

detailedDescription: As part of its mission to promote sustainable development, Al-Tayseer International for Construction has successfully completed the installation of a 100kW solar power station for the Joint Services Council of Beit Furik and Beit Dajan. This project aims to reduce reliance on conventional energy, lower operational costs, and contribute to a cleaner environment through renewable energy. The station powers municipal services, ensuring a reliable and eco-friendly energy source for the communities.

title: Al-Tayseer Eco-Agri Tourism Resort
description: An eco-tourism resort under construction in Ramallah, designed to promote sustainable, off-grid living through green building practices and integrated agriculture.

specifications.Sustainability Features: Off-grid systems, renewable energy, water harvesting
specifications.Purpose: Promoting sustainable tourism and environmental awareness
specifications.Design Approach: Green architecture integrated with local landscape

detailedDescription: Al-Tayseer Eco-Agri Tourism Resort is a pioneering project that combines sustainable construction, tourism, and agriculture. Located in Ramallah, this under-construction resort will offer guests a unique off-grid living experience, complete with renewable energy systems, eco-friendly buildings, and organic farming. The project is a key step towards promoting environmental awareness, sustainable development, and rural tourism in Palestine.

title: Solar Energy Systems for Irrigation Wells – Atil & Kafr Al-Labad
description: Installation of two 40kW solar energy units to power irrigation wells in Atil and Kafr Al-Labad agricultural cooperatives, funded by the Arab Organization and supervised by the Palestinian Ministry of Agriculture.
client: Palestinian Ministry of Agriculture / Arab Organization

specifications.Project Type: Solar energy systems for agricultural wells
specifications.Beneficiaries: Atil and Kafr Al-Labad Agricultural Cooperative Associations

features: Installed two 40kW solar units for agricultural wells
22% reduction in electricity consumption per well
Direct impact on lowering irrigation costs for farmers
Part of Palestine's Green Agriculture Cluster Development Plan
Executed with high standards and on schedule
detailedDescription: This project involved the installation of solar PV systems with a capacity of 40kW each for two major irrigation wells serving agricultural cooperatives in Atil and Kafr Al-Labad. It was funded by the Arab Organization and supervised by the Palestinian Ministry of Agriculture as part of the national plan for agricultural cluster development and energy sustainability. The systems now provide clean energy to the wells, reducing electricity consumption by 22% and lowering irrigation costs for local farmers. The project was executed by Al-Tayseer International Co., receiving high praise for quality and timely delivery.

title: 5kW Solar System – Kafr Aboush
description: Residential solar power system installation for Mr. Omar Hussein Abu Elias in Kafr Aboush, helping reduce monthly electricity costs significantly.
features: Monthly savings of up to 430 ILS
detailedDescription: We proudly celebrate the successful installation of a 5kW solar energy system for Mr. Omar Hussein Abu Elias in Kafr Aboush. This system is projected to save approximately 430 ILS per month in electricity costs. Implemented by Al-Tayseer International Co., this project demonstrates how solar energy can help reduce expenses and contribute to clean energy solutions. Be the next to benefit!

title: 50kW Solar Power Project – Azzun Municipality
description: Turnkey solar energy system delivered for Azzun Municipality, designed and executed by Al-Tayseer International for sustainable energy supply and operational cost reduction.

specifications.Purpose: Support municipal operations with clean energy

features: Significant reduction in municipal energy costs
detailedDescription: The solar energy project for Azzun Municipality, with a capacity of 50kWp, was successfully completed and delivered by Al-Tayseer International. This project aligns with the vision of clean energy adoption in Palestine, helping the municipality reduce operational costs and contribute to sustainable development. The system integrates high-efficiency solar components and adheres to all required standards for municipal infrastructure.

title: Solar Power Generation Plant – Bal'a Municipality
description: Engineering, installation, and commissioning of a solar power generation station for Bal'a Municipality, funded by the Municipal Development and Lending Fund (MDLF) under MDPIII.
features: Integrated with the main electrical grid
Supervised by municipal and MDLF engineers
detailedDescription: The solar energy project for Bal'a Municipality involved the complete establishment and commissioning of a solar power generation station. The project was funded by the Municipal Development and Lending Fund (MDLF) under the Municipal Development Program - Phase III, Second Cycle. Supervised by the engineering department of Bal'a Municipality (Eng. Widad Malek and Eng. Alaa Bourini) and MDLF representatives, and executed by Al-Tayseer International for Construction. The project was received by municipal officials including Mayor Farhan Shahrour and began supplying energy to the town's main grid network.
